ARABIC: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَٰمٌ وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ ٱلْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached advanced old age?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How can I have a son, O Lord" he said, "when my wife is barren and I am old and decrepit?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached an extremely old age?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He said, "Lord, how can I have a son? My wife is barren and I have reached an extremely old age".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He submitted, “My Lord – how can I have a son whereas my wife is barren and I have reached infirmity due to old age?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have reached the extreme old age."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: O my Lord! when shall I have a son, and my wife is barren, and I myself have reached indeed the extreme degree of old age?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'O my Lord, how shall I have a son, seeing my wife is barren, and I have attained to the declining of old age?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: My Lord!" [said Zachariah],  "How shall I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached such extreme old age?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: O my Lord! in what wise shall there be for me a boy, whereas my wife hath been barren, and surely have reached an age of extreme degree?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘My Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I am already advanced in age?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have reached the extreme old age."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: How shall I have a son, Lord' he asked, 'when my wife is barren, and I am advanced in years'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “My Lord, how can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have become decrepit with old age?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:8] He said, ‘My Lord, how shall I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age?’ (‘itiyyan, [derives] from [the verb] ‘atā, ‘it became withered’) in other words, [he had reached] extreme old age, 120 years; and his wife had reached the age of 98 (‘atiya in terms of its root derives from ‘utuwwun, but the tā’ is vowelled as -ti-, to soften it, the first wāw [vowel] is changed into a yā’ to be in harmony with the –ti- vowelling, while the second [wāw letter] is changed into a yā’ so that the [previous] yā’ can be assimilated with it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Zachariah said to Gabriel: (My Lord!) my master, (How can I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age) how can I have a son when my wife is barren and my body has become dry?; it is also said that this means: how can I have a son when my wife is barren and I am seventy two years of age?
